title: How to Make Vuetify available in Nuxt's context
body:
You'll probably are importing Vuetify.js in a plugin like: 
// plugins/vuetify.js

Vue.use(Vuetify, {...options})
> Thanks to using `Vue.use`, you have `$vuetify` available in your components instances. You can access to it with `this.$vuetify` (in the JS part of your component). But, what if we want to access to the Vuetify object in our context? Say in [`asyncData`, `fetch`, `plugins`, `middleware`s and `nuxtServerInit`](https://nuxtjs.org/api/context). You only need to add a few lines to your plugin: 
// plugins/vuetify.js

Vue.use(Vuetify, {...options})

export default function(_, inject) {
  // make \`$vuetify\` available in Nuxt context
  inject('vuetify', Vue.prototype.$vuetify)
}
